tournament.name: Friday 3rd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast high-cost spells for free, while controlling the board with removal spells and counterspells. The deck also takes advantage of the companion mechanic by including Yorion, Sky Nomad. The goal is to ramp up quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Growth Spiral, while also generating card advantage with planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The win condition is to establish a board presence with Shark Typhoon tokens and overpower the opponent with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath.

The deck revolves around efficiently controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention, allowing you to play spells for free while still having mana open for other cards. The deck includes powerful control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler, Narset of the Ancient Way, and Deafening Clarion to disrupt your opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck features key threats like Sphinx of Foresight, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith, the Returned King to close out the game once you have established control. The deck aims to out-value your opponent and maintain control of the game until you can secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful control spells while being able to ramp up quickly with the companion Keruga, the Macrosage. By managing resources effectively and controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Bonecrusher Giant, the deck aims to establish dominance and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient removal and powerful creatures like Kenrith, the Returned King and Cavalier of Flame. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Narset of the Ancient Way and Teferi, Time Raveler to maintain control and outvalue the opponent.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and instant removal spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent. By including Kaheera as a companion, the deck ensures additional synergy and versatility. The deck also includes diverse threats like Questing Beast and Cavalier of Thorns, as well as versatile removal options like Assassin's Trophy and Finale of Eternity. The mana base is strategically crafted to support the aggressive playstyle, with a mix of lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent by utilizing a combination of sacrificing creatures, recurring threats, and efficient removal spells. By utilizing cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods, Cauldron Familiar, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, the deck aims to disrupt and outpace the opponent's game plan while constantly applying pressure with cards like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Dreadhorde Butcher. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value by allowing the deck to recur important threats and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage, removal, and counter spells while utilizing powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to generate value. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent until you can win with a big Explosion or by overwhelming them with a large board of shark tokens. The deck also has ramp and card selection tools to help ensure you have the resources you need to dominate the late game.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with small and evasive creatures which can trigger Winota's ability to cheat out powerful and game-changing creatures such as Agent of Treachery. By generating a wide board presence and utilizing Winota's ability to its maximum potential, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Tithe Taker and Bonecrusher Giant. The mana base is optimized to support the multiple colors needed for the deck's powerful creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and Shatter the Sky to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also uses powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis to generate card advantage and incremental value. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents. With a mix of removal, card draw, and threats, this Bant Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a game of attrition.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and outvaluing opponents by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to maintain card advantage and board presence through cards like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Teferi, Time Raveler while also disrupting opponents with cards like Dovin's Veto and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck also includes powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Agent of Treachery to close out games. It utilizes a mix of lands to ensure it has the right colors of mana available at all times.

The deck focuses on establishing control of the game through board wipes and removal spells while using ramp and card draw to outvalue opponents. It aims to stabilize the board with powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and eventually take over the game with cards like Agent of Treachery and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to further control the game and generate card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free. The deck includes a mix of control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, along with aggressive threats like Cavalier of Flame and Bonecrusher Giant. By ramping up mana with Fires of Invention, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and creatures, allowing for a strong board presence and control over the tempo of the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board and slow down opponents while generating card advantage and value with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Fires of Invention. The deck features a mix of powerful threats and answers to opponents' strategies, aiming to stay ahead in the game through careful resource management and strategic plays. By utilizing a mix of control elements and powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and secure victory through a combination of card advantage and board presence.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Mystical Dispute. It also includes threats like Bonecrusher Giant and Sphinx of Foresight to apply pressure, as well as powerful finishers like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. The deck also includes key planeswalkers like Narset of the Ancient Way and Teferi, Time Raveler for additional control and card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support all the colors needed for the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence with small creatures that can quickly attack and deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Cruel Celebrant to sacrifice creatures and gain additional benefits. By combining aggression with sacrificing, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and achieve victory through a combination of damage and strategic plays. With a balance of aggression and sacrifice, the Orzhov Aggro archetype provides a versatile and dynamic playstyle.

The deck focuses on leveraging the damage boost granted by Obosh, the Preypiercer to enhance the aggressive strategy of Rakdos Aggro. The deck includes a mix of sacrifice synergies with cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Woe Strider, as well as recurring threats like Gutterbones. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Judith, the Scourge Diva to keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, damage-focused strategy fueled by Rakdos creatures and synergies.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counter spells and removal, while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to eventually cast powerful spells like Shark Typhoon and Expansion / Explosion. The deck aims to continuously generate value and card advantage through its various engines, with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath providing a strong mid-game threat. The inclusion of some versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Thassa's Intervention allows for flexibility in dealing with various situations.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to utilize powerful removal spells, card advantage engines, and high-impact threats to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Extinction Event, Thought Erasure, Heartless Act, and Casualties of War, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping into powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Hydroid Krasis, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to all of its colors and ensures smooth gameplay throughout the match.
